alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:26AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington, south central Clarke, Escambia, southwestern Covington, Okaloosa, northern Santa Rosa and northwestern Escambia Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 726 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Stockton to 10 miles north of Point Baker to 6 miles west of Eglin Air Force Base. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crestview, Bay Minette, Atmore, Brewton, Century, Flomaton, Baker, Stockton, McCullough, East Brewton, Axis, Mount Vernon, Calvert, Jay, Laurel Hill, McIntosh, Pollard, Riverview, I65 And AL 113 and I65 And AL 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland
